bitfield.description: Suspend signal selection. Selects which suspend signal affects the peripheral. Only valid when SUSPEND_DEFAULT_OVERRIDE=0 and SENSCTRL=1. When read, these bits reflect the default suspend signal. 0000b: CPU suspend signal. All other values are reserved.

Enable or disable the override value in SUSPEND_SEL. 0: SUSPEND_SEL field will select which suspend signal reaches the peripheral. 1: SUSPEND_SEL field ignored. Default suspend signal will reach the peripheral.

Sensitivity Control for suspend signals. When SUSPEND_DEFAULT_OVERRIDE=1, this bit is ignored and read as a 1. When SUSPEND_DEFAULT_OVERRIDE=0, 0: Suspend signal will not reach the peripheral. Peripheral will act as normal even during a debug halt. 1: Suspend signal will reach the peripheral. Peripheral will be suspended during debug halt.

Suspend signal selection. Selects which suspend signal affects the peripheral. Only valid when SUSPEND_DEFAULT_OVERRIDE=0 and SENSCTRL=1. When read, these bits reflect the default suspend signal. 0000b: CPU suspend signal. All other values are reserved.

Enable or disable the override value in SUSPEND_SEL. 0: SUSPEND_SEL field will select which suspend signal reaches the peripheral. 1: SUSPEND_SEL field ignored. Default suspend signal will reach the peripheral.

Sensitivity Control for suspend signals. When SUSPEND_DEFAULT_OVERRIDE=1, this bit is ignored and read as a 1. When SUSPEND_DEFAULT_OVERRIDE=0, 0: Suspend signal will not reach the peripheral. Peripheral will act as normal even during a debug halt. 1: Suspend signal will reach the peripheral. Peripheral will be suspended during debug halt.
